Class ReviewController

java.lang.Object
com.FeedEmGreens.HealthyAura.controller.ReviewController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews") public class ReviewController extends Object
Controller responsible for handling review-related operations for eateries.

This controller provides endpoints to:

  • Create, update, and delete user reviews
  • Fetch reviews and aggregated ratings for eateries
  • Flag inappropriate reviews for moderation

Endpoints are mapped under /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews, and delegate core logic to the ReviewService.

Error responses are handled gracefully with meaningful messages and appropriate HTTP status codes.

Since:
2025-11-07
Version:
1.0

      public ReviewController()

  • Method Details

    • createOrUpdateReview

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> createOrUpdateReview(@PathVariable Long eateryId, @RequestBody ReviewRequest request)
      Creates or updates a user's review for a specific eatery.

      If the user already has a review for the given eatery, the existing review will be updated instead of creating a new one.

      Endpoint: POST /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery being reviewed
      request - the review data, including rating, comments, and other fields
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing success or error messages and the saved review

    • getReviews

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getReviews(@PathVariable Long eateryId, @RequestParam(required=false,defaultValue="RECENT") String sortBy)
      Retrieves all reviews for a specific eatery.

      Results can be optionally sorted by a given parameter such as RECENT, RATING_HIGH, or RATING_LOW.

      Endpoint: GET /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery
      sortBy - optional sorting criteria (defaults to RECENT)
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the list of reviews or a message if none exist

    • getMyReview

      @GetMapping("/my-review") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getMyReview(@PathVariable Long eateryId)
      Retrieves the currently authenticated user's own review for a specific eatery.

      If the user has not written a review for this eatery, a message indicating “No review found” will be returned.

      Endpoint: GET /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews/my-review

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the user’s review or an informational message

    • updateReview

      @PutMapping("/{reviewId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateReview(@PathVariable Long eateryId, @PathVariable Long reviewId, @RequestBody ReviewRequest request)
      Updates an existing review for a given eatery.

      This endpoint allows a user to edit their previous review content or rating.

      Endpoint: PUT /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews/{reviewId}

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery being reviewed
      reviewId - the ID of the review to update
      request - the updated review data
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated review and a confirmation message

    • deleteReview

      @DeleteMapping("/{reviewId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteReview(@PathVariable Long eateryId, @PathVariable Long reviewId)
      Deletes a user's review for a specific eatery.

      This permanently removes the review record and is typically followed by a recalculation of the eatery’s overall ratings.

      Endpoint: DELETE /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews/{reviewId}

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery associated with the review
      reviewId - the ID of the review to delete
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a success or error message

    • flagReview

      @PostMapping("/{reviewId}/flag") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> flagReview(@PathVariable Long eateryId, @PathVariable Long reviewId, @RequestBody ReviewFlagRequest request)
      Flags a review as inappropriate or violating community guidelines.

      This endpoint allows users to report reviews containing offensive, spammy, or misleading content. The flag is recorded for admin moderation.

      Endpoint: POST /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews/{reviewId}/flag

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery where the review was posted
      reviewId - the ID of the review being flagged
      request - the ReviewFlagRequest containing the reason for flagging
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a confirmation or error message

    • getAggregatedRatings

      @GetMapping("/ratings") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getAggregatedRatings(@PathVariable Long eateryId)
      Retrieves aggregated rating statistics for a specific eatery.

      The response includes metrics such as average rating, total reviews, and rating distribution across different star levels.

      Endpoint: GET /api/eateries/{eateryId}/reviews/ratings

      Parameters:
      eateryId - the ID of the eatery
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing an AggregatedRatingsResponse object
